message.content: We refer to Mayo Clinic for help. Anti-SS-B (also known as anti-La) antibodies are often found in individuals with Sjögren’s syndrome, so this option is the most likely to be positive if the woman’s daughter were to develop the condition. None of the other options are typically associated with Sjögren’s syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly seen in patients with primary Sjögren’s syndrome. None of the other options are associated with Sjögren’s syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly present in patients with Sjögren’s syndrome. Anti-cyclic citrullinated antibodies are found in patients with rheumatoid arthritis, anti-histone antibodies are found in drug-induced lupus, and anti-topoisomerase (anti-Scl 70) antibodies are found in systemic sclerosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in patients with Sjögren’s syndrome. This is due to an autoimmune reaction that targets the salivary and lacrimal glands, causing dry mouth and dry eyes. The other options are not specific to Sjögren’s syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in individuals with Sjögren’s syndrome, and the presence of these antibodies is often used as a diagnostic marker for the condition. The other antibodies listed are associated with other autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis (anti-cyclic citrullinated antibodies), drug-induced lupus (anti-histone antibodies), and systemic sclerosis (anti-topoisomerase antibodies).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in patients with Sjögren's syndrome. The other options are associated with other autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis (anti-cyclic citrullinated antibodies), drug-induced lupus (anti-histone antibodies), and systemic sclerosis (anti-topoisomerase antibodies).
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in Sjögren’s syndrome. All other options are associated with different autoimmune diseases.

We refer to PubMed articles on autoantibodies in Sjögren's syndrome for help. Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in patients with Sjögren’s syndrome, whereas the other options are associated with other diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, drug-induced lupus, and systemic sclerosis. Thus, if the daughter were to develop Sjögren’s syndrome, anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies may be positive.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are commonly found in patients with Sjögren’s syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Anti-SS-B (anti-La) antibodies are associated with Sjögren’s syndrome. Anti-cyclic citrullinated antibodies are associated with rheumatoid arthritis, anti-histone antibodies with drug-induced lupus, and anti-topoisomerase (anti-Scl 70) antibodies with systemic sclerosis.
